channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Novel Collaborative Self-Supervised Learning Method for Radiomic Data
item.description: We compared our proposed method with other state-of-the-art self-supervised learning methods on a simulation study and two independent datasets.

item.title: iQPP: A Benchmark for Image Query Performance Prediction
item.description: To date, query performance prediction (QPP) in the context of content-based image retrieval remains a largely unexplored task, especially in the query-by-example scenario, where the query is an image.

item.title: Composer: Creative and Controllable Image Synthesis with Composable Conditions
item.description: Recent large-scale generative models learned on big data are capable of synthesizing incredible images yet suffer from limited controllability.

item.title: Analyzing the Posterior Collapse in Hierarchical Variational Autoencoders
item.description: Hierarchical Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) are among the most popular likelihood-based generative models.

item.title: Incremental Few-Shot Object Detection via Simple Fine-Tuning Approach
item.description: In this paper, we explore incremental few-shot object detection (iFSD), which incrementally learns novel classes using only a few examples without revisiting base classes.

item.title: HTNet: Human Topology Aware Network for 3D Human Pose Estimation
item.description: 3D human pose estimation errors would propagate along the human body topology and accumulate at the end joints of limbs.

item.title: Friend Recall in Online Games via Pre-training Edge Transformers
item.description: Friend recall is an important way to improve Daily Active Users (DAU) in Tencent games.

item.title: Query Performance Prediction for Neural IR: Are We There Yet?
item.description: On top of that, in lexical-oriented scenarios, QPPs fail to predict performance for neural IR systems on those queries where they differ from traditional approaches the most.

item.title: A Survey on Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation is one of the most challenging tasks in computer vision.

item.title: Demonstration-Guided Reinforcement Learning with Efficient Exploration for Task Automation of Surgical Robot
item.description: Task automation of surgical robot has the potentials to improve surgical efficiency.

item.title: Hashtag-Guided Low-Resource Tweet Classification
item.description: Social media classification tasks (e. g., tweet sentiment analysis, tweet stance detection) are challenging because social media posts are typically short, informal, and ambiguous.

item.title: Cross-domain Compositing with Pretrained Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models have enabled high-quality, conditional image editing capabilities.

item.title: Large-scale Multi-Modal Pre-trained Models: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: With the urgent demand for generalized deep models, many pre-trained big models are proposed, such as BERT, ViT, GPT, etc.

item.title: Because Every Sensor Is Unique, so Is Every Pair: Handling Dynamicity in Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Further analysis also shows that each pair of sensors also has a unique dynamic.

item.title: Metropolis Theorem and Its Applications in Single Image Detail Enhancement
item.description: Traditional image detail enhancement is local filter-based or global filter-based.

item.title: RecFNO: a resolution-invariant flow and heat field reconstruction method from sparse observations via Fourier neural operator
item.description: The MLP embedding is propitious to more sparse input, while the others benefit from spatial information preservation and perform better with the increase of observation data.

item.title: Can discrete information extraction prompts generalize across language models?
item.description: We study whether automatically-induced prompts that effectively extract information from a language model can also be used, out-of-the-box, to probe other language models for the same information.

item.title: CMVAE: Causal Meta VAE for Unsupervised Meta-Learning
item.description: Unsupervised meta-learning aims to learn the meta knowledge from unlabeled data and rapidly adapt to novel tasks.

item.title: PriSTI: A Conditional Diffusion Framework for Spatiotemporal Imputation
item.description: Our proposed framework provides a conditional feature extraction module first to extract the coarse yet effective spatiotemporal dependencies from conditional information as the global context prior.

item.title: Nystrom Method for Accurate and Scalable Implicit Differentiation
item.description: The essential difficulty of gradient-based bilevel optimization using implicit differentiation is to estimate the inverse Hessian vector product with respect to neural network parameters.

item.title: Interactive Face Video Coding: A Generative Compression Framework
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel framework for Interactive Face Video Coding (IFVC), which allows humans to interact with the intrinsic visual representations instead of the signals.

item.title: What happens before and after: Multi-Event Commonsense in Event Coreference Resolution
item.description: Event coreference models cluster event mentions pertaining to the same real-world event.

item.title: Improving User Controlled Table-To-Text Generation Robustness
item.description: In this work we study user controlled table-to-text generation where users explore the content in a table by selecting cells and reading a natural language description thereof automatically produce by a natural language generator.

item.title: Escaping limit cycles: Global convergence for constrained nonconvex-nonconcave minimax problems
item.description: This paper introduces a new extragradient-type algorithm for a class of nonconvex-nonconcave minimax problems.

item.title: Toward Asymptotic Optimality: Sequential Unsupervised Regression of Density Ratio for Early Classification
item.description: Theoretically-inspired sequential density ratio estimation (SDRE) algorithms are proposed for the early classification of time series.

item.title: A DNN based Normalized Time-frequency Weighted Criterion for Robust Wideband DoA Estimation
item.description: However, the best-performing design of T-F weights is criterion-dependent in general.

item.title: Towards Unbounded Machine Unlearning
item.description: Deep machine unlearning is the problem of removing the influence of a cohort of data from the weights of a trained deep model.

item.title: Accelerated Video Annotation driven by Deep Detector and Tracker
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new annotation method which leverages a combination of a learning-based detector (SSD) and a learning-based tracker (RE$^3$).

item.title: Rethinking Data-Free Quantization as a Zero-Sum Game
item.description: how to generate the samples with desirable adaptability to benefit the quantized network?

item.title: Mixed Hierarchy Network for Image Restoration
item.description: Our main proposal is a mixed hierarchy architecture, that progressively recovers contextual information and spatial details from degraded images while we design intra-blocks to reduce system complexity.

item.title: Guided Deep Kernel Learning
item.description: Combining Gaussian processes with the expressive power of deep neural networks is commonly done nowadays through deep kernel learning (DKL).

item.title: Distributional Offline Policy Evaluation with Predictive Error Guarantees
item.description: In our theoretical results, we show that for both finite and infinite horizon discounted settings, FLE can learn distributions that are close to the ground truth under total variation distance and Wasserstein distance, respectively.

item.title: Text Classification in the Wild: a Large-scale Long-tailed Name Normalization Dataset
item.description: In this work, we first collect a large-scale institution name normalization dataset LoT-insts1, which contains over 25k classes that exhibit a naturally long-tailed distribution.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Label Learning Flows
item.description: In this paper, we develop label learning flows (LLF), a general framework for weakly supervised learning problems.

item.title: Guided Depth Map Super-resolution: A Survey
item.description: Guided depth map super-resolution (GDSR), which aims to reconstruct a high-resolution (HR) depth map from a low-resolution (LR) observation with the help of a paired HR color image, is a longstanding and fundamental problem, it has attracted considerable attention from computer vision and image processing communities.

item.title: SanskritShala: A Neural Sanskrit NLP Toolkit with Web-Based Interface for Pedagogical and Annotation Purposes
item.description: We present a neural Sanskrit Natural Language Processing (NLP) toolkit named SanskritShala (a school of Sanskrit) to facilitate computational linguistic analyses for several tasks such as word segmentation, morphological tagging, dependency parsing, and compound type identification.

item.title: Intent Identification and Entity Extraction for Healthcare Queries in Indic Languages
item.description: Scarcity of data and technological limitations for resource-poor languages in developing countries like India poses a threat to the development of sophisticated NLU systems for healthcare.

item.title: Topological Feature Selection: A Graph-Based Filter Feature Selection Approach
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel unsupervised, graph-based filter feature selection technique which exploits the power of topologically constrained network representations.

item.title: Exploring the Potential of Machine Translation for Generating Named Entity Datasets: A Case Study between Persian and English
item.description: This study focuses on the generation of Persian named entity datasets through the application of machine translation on English datasets.

item.title: Latent Class-Conditional Noise Model
item.description: We solve this problem by introducing a Latent Class-Conditional Noise model (LCCN) to parameterize the noise transition under a Bayesian framework.

item.title: Human Emotion Knowledge Representation Emerges in Large Language Models and Supports Discrete Emotion Inference
item.description: As the large language models (LLMs) have been shown to support effective representations of various human conceptual knowledge, the present study further employed artificial neurons in LLMs to investigate the mechanism of human emotion inference.

item.title: Multilingual Content Moderation: A Case Study on Reddit
item.description: Content moderation is the process of flagging content based on pre-defined platform rules.

item.title: Disentangled Representation for Causal Mediation Analysis
item.description: Causal mediation analysis is a method that is often used to reveal direct and indirect effects.

item.title: BERT is not The Count: Learning to Match Mathematical Statements with Proofs
item.description: While the first decoding method matches a proof to a statement without being aware of other statements or proofs, the second method treats the task as a global matching problem.

item.title: Calibrating the Rigged Lottery: Making All Tickets Reliable
item.description: Previous research has shown that deep neural networks tend to be over-confident, and we find that sparse training exacerbates this problem.

item.title: Eco-evolutionary Dynamics of Non-episodic Neuroevolution in Large Multi-agent Environments
item.description: Neuroevolution (NE) has recently proven a competitive alternative to learning by gradient descent in reinforcement learning tasks.

item.title: Knowledge Graph Completion based on Tensor Decomposition for Disease Gene Prediction
item.description: In this paper, we construct a biological knowledge graph centered on diseases and genes, and develop an end-to-end Knowledge graph completion model for Disease Gene Prediction using interactional tensor decomposition (called KDGene).

item.title: Transformer-Based Neural Marked Spatio Temporal Point Process Model for Football Match Events Analysis
item.description: However, most sports sequential events modeling methods and performance metrics approaches could be incomprehensive in dealing with such large-scale spatiotemporal data (in particular, temporal process), thereby necessitating a more comprehensive spatiotemporal model and a holistic performance metric.

item.title: A Federated Approach for Hate Speech Detection
item.description: Hate speech detection has been the subject of high research attention, due to the scale of content created on social media.

item.title: How Good Are GPT Models at Machine Translation? A Comprehensive Evaluation
item.description: In this paper, we present a comprehensive evaluation of GPT models for machine translation, covering various aspects such as quality of different GPT models in comparison with state-of-the-art research and commercial systems, effect of prompting strategies, robustness towards domain shifts and document-level translation.
